revised_title: Enhanced Emission of Low Energy Positrons from Metal Surfaces using a Time of Flight Method
tldr: The authors developed a time of flight method to investigate the emission of low energy positrons from metal surfaces using a weak radioactive source. By designing a source assembly with a gold-lined collimating cylinder, they significantly increased the yield of low energy positrons. This method allows for the study of positron-atom interactions and the potential for producing a suitable beam of monoenergetic positrons for scattering experiments.
